title: River Crossing

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: This might be the end of our war. The Northern and Central Armies have merged. A force of that size is too powerful for us. If Tibarn and Naesala can't help us, it might be a good idea to go back to Gallia and regroup. Convincing Skrimir won't be easy, but I can't let our people get killed in a hopeless battle.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Understood. Ranulf, this is your war, so I'll follow your orders. I have to say, though, retreating won't be easy. According to Soren, the Central Army has mobilized and begun marching on our position during the last few days.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: They finally brought in a competent commander, huh? Hmmm... Our path is blocked both ways.  Hey!

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Hello, boys. It's good to know you two still hang out together.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Tibarn! Glad to see you're safe! But, what happened?! Didn't the bird tribes hit the supply unit? The Begnion Central Army is here, and they're marching on us!

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Talk later, eat now. Sorry, but I gotta put something in my stomach and get some rest...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: How's Tibarn?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: He's resting inside that tent over there. Ike, did you see them? Did you see his wings?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Yeah. They were covered in blood. He's not hurt, so it must be someone else's...

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: I have this awful feeling... A feeling that something terrible has happened. I really hope I'm wrong...

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: Ike! Ranulf!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Reyson! You're here, too?

intro.speaker: Janaff
intro.line: Your Highness! Please wait!

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: I have to check on him. I'm worried about Tibarn.

intro.speaker: Ulki
intro.line: We're worried too, but Reyson can't just let him be for a while.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Janaff, Ulki, what's going on? What happened to you out there?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Naesala and the ravens of Kilvas betrayed us? Again?

intro.speaker: Janaff
intro.line: I'm so mad I can barely see straight! The ravens were informants. They told Begnion our battle strategy.

intro.speaker: Ulki
intro.line: It was a trap. The supply unit we raided turned out to be the Central Army itself. The troops were under the command of Begnion's most famous general, Zelgius.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: General Zelgius? This just got a lot worse...

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: You've heard of him?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I met him during the Mad King's War. He's powerful, experienced, and clever. One of the best generals of our time.

intro.speaker: Janaff
intro.line: Yeah. For a beorc, he was quite powerful all right. Tibarn, while shifted, mind you, attacked this Zelgius guy. Zelgius didn't even budge an inch. But all of a sudden he stopped fighting and said, "We've delayed you long enough. If you cherish the lives of your people, return home at once."

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: He said that?

intro.speaker: Ulki
intro.line: So the king made a decision. We flew night and day and reached Phoenicis, but...it was too late. Save for the elderly, women, and children, they were all...

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: I also heard what happened, and... I just couldn't believe it. Naesala has betrayed us once again. I cannot believe he'd play a role in wiping out Phoenicis...
Hey, we're not wiped out yet.

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: Huh?

intro.speaker: Reyson
intro.line: Tibarn!

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: I'm alive and well. My people are few, but they still live. Phoenicis is still a country. Janaff. Ulki. You know what we must do.

intro.speaker: Janaff
intro.line: Of course!

intro.speaker: Ulki
intro.line: Yes. Begnion and Kilvas will burn for this.

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: ...So, that's the whole story. Sorry we were late, but now we're here to stay and see this war out. Don't tell me you kittens are going to run off with your tails between your legs. I won't accept that.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Of course not, King Tibarn! I'll get Skrimir right now. A slight delay, but now that we've merged with the hawk tribe, we have the strength to fight.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Our goal is to cross the Ribahn. The core of our forces will ford the river and attack the Central Army head-on. Ranulf, you'll need to form a small unit of your best warriors and lead them behind enemy lines, undetected. Can you do it?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: No sweat. We'll do some officer hunting and keep their leaders' attention on us.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Good. But a distraction alone will not get us across the river. They've got the terrain and Zelgius in their favor.

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: Bah! Use fewer words, tiny beorc! Tell us what we must do! Some of us have a battle to fight!

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Don't interrupt me again, Skrimir. All these words may be the only thing that can possibly win this battle. As I was saying, while Ranulf and his men sow confusion in the rear ranks, a group of hawk laguz will carry the Greil Mercenaries south, around the battlefield. We'll cross the river and make our way to the supply train, which also serves as the senators' camp.

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Ahhh, I see what you're doing. You're going to involve the senators and have them start messing things up.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Precisely. Zelgius is the military commander, but the senators have authority over him. If attacked, they will panic and request aid. He will be forced to return and rescue them. Zelgius is a soldier through and through. He will not disobey an order, no matter how foolish it might be. Once he leaves, their front line will crumble. That's when you advance. Tibarn and Skrimir will lead the charge. That's all. Is everyone clear on what they have to do?

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: Hmph. I still dislike beorc tactics. I'd rather face my enemy and give him my name before I snap his neck in my jaws. But in order to defeat cowards, we must use the weapons of cowards. Let's go.

intro.speaker: Levail
intro.line: General Zelgius! The men are in position.

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: Good work. Hm... It's becoming foggy.

intro.speaker: Levail
intro.line: It looks like the hawk tribe has joined with the main force, but I'm sure this fog will hinder them.

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: I wouldn't be too sure about that. The fog might actually be a boon to them. We'll wait and see what move they make.

intro.speaker: Begnion
intro.line: General! We hear splashing. The Laguz Alliance is on the move!

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: The van's marching. Halfway across the river already. There's no point in waiting.  Oh, well. Enemy'll spot them soon.

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: Then it's time to fight. You should go.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Don't remind me. I hate flying. Anyway, give the word, will you?

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: No need. Our friends heard every word.

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: Ah. Finally it's time. I've had enough of sitting around. To wing, brothers! Keep up with me if you can!

intro.speaker: Begnion
intro.line: My lord?

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: It's nothing. I'm needed elsewhere. Keep them engaged until I return.

intro.speaker: Begnion
intro.line: Yes, sir.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Well, well... Sorry to drop in unannounced. We thought it best to hunt the strongest prey first.

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: Of course. Interesting maneuver.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Will you draw your blade?

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: I trust you know who you face. Zelgius, commander of this army. If you are not worthy of fighting me, then you are only wasting my time.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: I'm Ranulf, right-hand to Gallia's future king.  Will that do?

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: We shall see. I shall accept your challenge.

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: At your ready.

intro.speaker: Senator
intro.line: What is all that noise? And at this hour!

intro.speaker: Veyona
intro.line: A battle has begun on the other side of the woods, near the river.

intro.speaker: Senator
intro.line: Then tell Zelgius to wipe out the sub-humans quickly and quiet down! I cannot sleep with all this racket. Don't you peasants know I need my beauty sleep?! I should have you all flogged, you inconsiderate fools!

intro.speaker: Veyona
intro.line: Wretched snob...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: We're in. Soren, let's go over the plan one more time.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Our objective is to destroy the enemy supplies. The senators store their food and personal effects in crates. If we burn those crates, the senators will likely pull their troops back to protect their own hides.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: So, while the laguz distract the enemy, we force the gate open, storm inside, and burn all the supplies.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Exactly.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: We can also set their horses loose. That should add to the confusion.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Agreed. Also, please try not to hurt the senators themselves. Harming them might cause us trouble later on, especially once the fighting is over.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: All right. We've got to finish before the fog burns off. Let's get this done. Attack!

battle.speaker: Begnion
battle.line: Enemies in the camp! We're under attack!

battle.speaker: Veyona
battle.line: How interesting! I never expected them to attack this particular camp. While the senators may deserve to get kicked around a little bit, I cannot let my general down. I shall protect this camp with all my power.  Soldiers of Begnion! Wipe out the bandits! Kill every last one of them!

visit.speaker: Begnion
visit.line: You're with the Laguz Alliance? W-wait! Please! I don't want to die for those useless, decrepit old senators! I'm getting out of here. You can take whatever you want from this stash. Thanks!

visit.speaker: Lass
visit.line: What? Um...yes, I was ordered to keep the lord's valuables neat and tidy. But the lord, he ran away, and, well... What, this? He told me it was very precious. Here, you take it.

visit.speaker: Senator
visit.line: Aaaaahhh!  P-please! I beg of you! Spare me! Mercy!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: The fog is about to clear. Our work is done. Let's pull back!

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: I'm impressed that you've held out this long, but it's over now. Good-bye, Ranulf.

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: Pray to the goddess. You're finished.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Ahh... I tried...

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: Farewell.

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: What?!

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: Hey, there. Y'know, you look kinda familiar.

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: The king of Phoenicis! Why did you transform? Do you not wish to fight me?

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: Oh, I wish to fight you, all right. Unfortunately, I don't really have the time. So, I'll let you go this time.

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: What do you mean?

end.speaker: Begnion
end.line: General Zelgius! You must return at once! Our supply camp is in flames! We need you to take control of the situation!

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: What?!

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: I see. Now I understand.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: You were kind enough to tell me of the attack on my country. I'm only returning the favor.

end.speaker: Zelgius
end.line: Understood. I accept the favor, then.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: I'll let you go this time. Next time we meet, keep your sword drawn and make sure you've said your prayers.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Ugh...

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: Hey, how are you doing? Thanks to Ike, the army is crossing the river as we speak. We should go join Skrimir. Can you move?

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: No...

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: Damn. Fine, I'll carry you. Don't get thrown off, kid. You better hang on tight!

narration: The Laguz Alliance, bolstered by the hawk tribe and by Soren's tactical genius, thunders across the Begnion-held river. Emboldened by their success, they move east with amazing speed and capture the northern stronghold, Castle Seliora. The Laguz Alliance has made a vital step in its march toward the Begnion capital, Sienne.

Begnion has now lost a valuable defensive line in the Ribahn River, and the Central Army has been forced to retreat east, taking refuge in Castle Gaddos. The morale of the Begnion soldiers is kept high by their faith in General Zelgius, while the Begnion nobles smolder with resentment at their defeat.

conversation.speaker: Tibarn
conversation.line: Your strategist is something else. Does he have some kind of magic hat that he pulls all his crazy ideas out of?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Well, I do pay him plenty for them.

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: Soren said this mission would fail without help from the Phoenicis Army. We’re asking you to take a very big risk, King Tibarn.

conversation.speaker: Tibarn
conversation.line: We can handle it. We can do anything if it involves teaching those vermin in Begnion a thing or two.

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: Soren has even answered some of Skrimir’s more insane requests. He doesn’t listen to a word I say, but when Soren talks strategy, he’s all ears.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Is that why he hasn’t been complaining during the briefings?

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: He says he looks forward to what the little strategist will say next. It looks to me like Soren’s charmed his way into the most powerful position in this army.

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: I’m glad to hear it. He’s changed, hasn’t he?

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: Yeah, I think so. He still doesn’t say much, but he’s a lot more at ease these days. He used to be completely closed off, rejecting anyone who tried to get close. Like he’d lock himself away, all alone in his own little world.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: We all lost and gained something during the Mad King’s War. Maybe it wasn’t a complete waste, after all.

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: Do you think we’ll feel the same way about this war when it’s over?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Who knows? We’ll have to survive it first.
